Text: Pardon my ignorance, but is the hosts file supposed to be set as read only? By default there is no read only flag on it.

@bert16

No need for that..! 
by default it should be 'read only' though!

Just make sure u add the links otherwise idm will render ur license invalid everytime u attempt to download!

It doesnt matter if u wish to put the host file back to read only! go ahead !

By default the hosts file "should" be read only, but since I've had Windows 7-64 it has never been. I'll follow your advice just leave it as is. Sometime ago unknown to me, the line "127.0.0.1 validation.sls.microsoft.com" was put in there, and I don't remember having done it. I just left it alone and my Windows is still activated.

I installed your torrent following your instructions and "just in case" changed the hosts file to read only. I might take off the read only flag in a few days, let's see. I do have another question, though. The portable you put in there, what's that for and how do you use it? Is it just for Internet Explorer since there's a small iexplore.exe in there?

Portable is a prelicense portable version of idm...
iexplorer is for integration with internet explorer thats all!!

it should work fine!

I installed IDM and it's working great. I set the hosts file to read only just in case. What I don't understand is why did you put in that pre-license portable version? What does it do and is it pre-cracked?

im using windows xp. after installing idm, whenever i start windows, i get an error msg that '12 files required for browser integration are missing in idm'  .... what should i do to remove this error?
